abstract: Republican lawmakers have been sharply critical of the Fed chairman’s role in the takeover of Merrill Lynch.
snippet: Republican lawmakers have been sharply critical of the Fed chairman’s role in the takeover of Merrill Lynch.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  In a peculiar role reversal, Republican lawmakers are mounting a ferocious attack on the Republican chairman of the Federal Reserve, while Democrats are coming to his defense.

headline.main: G.O.P. to Paint Bernanke as Big Government Ally
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Expected to Paint Bernanke as Ally of Big Government

byline.original: By Edmund L. Andrews and Louise Story

abstract: In testimony before a House committee, the Federal Reserve chief said he did not pressure bank management to complete the deal.
snippet: In testimony before a House committee, the Federal Reserve chief said he did not pressure bank management to complete the deal.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Ben S. Bernanke, the chairman of the Federal Reserve, staunchly denied on Thursday that he or anyone else at the Fed did anything improper in prodding Bank of America to complete its ill-starred takeover of Merrill Lynch last year.

abstract: The Fed chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, testified before the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee about his role in Bank of America’s acquisition of Merrill Lynch. DealBook live-blogged the hearing.
snippet: The Fed chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, testified before the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee about his role in Bank of America’s acquisition of Merrill Lynch. DealBook live-blogged the hearing.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve’s chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, testified Thursday before the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee about his role in persuading Bank of America to complete its acquisition of Merrill Lynch. DealBook’s Zachery Kouwe live-blogged the hearing, with the most recent posts at the top:

headline.main: Live-Blogging Ben Bernanke on Capitol Hill

abstract: Ben S. Bernanke, the chairman of the Federal Reserve, staunchly denied putting improper pressure on Bank of America to complete its ill-starred merger with Merrill Lynch last December.
snippet: Ben S. Bernanke, the chairman of the Federal Reserve, staunchly denied putting improper pressure on Bank of America to complete its ill-starred merger with Merrill Lynch last December.
lead_paragraph: Ben S. Bernanke, the chairman of the Federal Reserve, staunchly denied putting improper pressure on Bank of America to complete its ill-starred merger with Merrill Lynch last December, The New York Times’s Edmund L. Andrews and Louise Story report.

headline.main: Bernanke Defends His Role in Merrill Sale
